fields.description:
Fisheye/Jira automatically discovers Perforce changelists related to a bug and populates the Source tab. Once the bug is fixed in the trunk, the tab gets polluted with p4pull changelists as the fix is pulled into people's branches. We need to filter p4pull changelists from the Source tab.

Please ignore any submit message which contains the following string:
Automatic submit by p4pull

The Perforce mail scripts ignore those changes.
fields.summary: Add a filter to ignore commit message patterns in the JIRA / FishEye plugin

We would like that FishEye have an option to set his timeout trough its UI.

Thank you in advance.

Cheers,
Douglas Fabretti
Atlassian Support.

fields.description:
Hi there.

When adding a GIT Managed Repository in FishEye it is created with a location like: /opt/atlassian/fecru/managed-repos/git.

When you try to set a Password Authentication to that Repo it fails with an error:

{noformat}
Error testing connection.
C:\Users\dfabretti\Desktop\Atlassian\Instances\fecru-2.7.10\bin\..\managed-repos\abc.git is not a valid url
at com.cenqua.fisheye.util.UrlUtils.addAuthentication(UrlUtils.java:179)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.dvcs.DvcsScmConfig.getRemoteLocationWithCredentials(DvcsScmConfig.java:116)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.git.GitScmConfig.testConnection(GitScmConfig.java:156)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.RepositoryConfig.testConnection(RepositoryConfig.java:450)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.spi.admin.impl.DefaultRepositoryAdminService.testConnectionFor(DefaultRepositoryAdminService.java:540)
Connection failed.
{noformat}

I discovered a workaround for that by doing the following:

{panel}
# Stop FishEye.
# Edit your config.xml.
# Locate your GIT repository:
# Add *file://* in front of the <git location=".../managed-repos/abc.git" ...>
# Start FishEye.
# Go to the Repository options.
# Add the password and Test the Connection again.
{panel}

Thank you in advance.

Cheers,
Douglas Fabretti
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Display repository URLs for managed Git repos instead of file system path in the admin
Revamp FECRU Installation docs

fields.description:
The problem can be reproduced if the only license provided is the Fisheye one.

In this case, the *Reviews* tab under the Projects menu will not be displayed and it would not be accessible through its URL (AA Analytics.jpg).

However, when a user adds a project to his/her Favorites, instead of using the link for the "Activity" tab (which is the only available in the Projects menu), Fisheye is still using the the link to the "Reviews" tab, which is not available (USer3 User3 Home.jpg).

This causes the app to report the error (screenshot-2.jpg).

Fixing the problem: if only the Fisheye license is provided, projects added to the user Favorites should direct the user to the project "Activity" tab, not the "Reviews" tab.

Activity tab: https://domain/project/PROJECT
Reviews tab: https://domain/cru/browse/PROJECT
fields.summary: If only the Fisheye License is provided, projects are added to the "Favorites" with an illegal link

fields.description:
In FishEye 2.6 and prior, when the user synchronisation could not retrieve an user (either because of a communication error or because the user was removed in LDAP/Crowd/etc.), the user would be deleted.

Later, if an user was re-created with the same username, the original user was restored (along with his admin rights (FE-3712) and all his Crucible data).

Because of this, any transient failures or migration between authentication providers would not be visible to the users. An user would automatically be _deleted_ but _then restored_ in any successive synchronisation from any provider (LDAP, Crowd, etc.), if the username matches.

2.7 changed this behaviour by making the user deletion strict and irreversible. Creating an user with the same username as a deleted user does not restore the old user. However this has caused a lot of headaches for the support team as any migration between the authentication providers are now permanent and does not restore the old users after migration.

A solution for this is to restore the undocumented behaviour of 2.6 and prior versions: restore any user matching a deleted user with the same username.
fields.summary: Emulate pre-2.7 behaviour: when an user is created by the user synchronisation, restore any deleted user with the same username
Remove the unused metadata upgrade code in BaseRepositoryScanner.slurpRepository()

fields.description:
We should filter the paths to content index for SVN (and p4) as we do here: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/~br=2.7-FECRU-1957-content-dupes/FE-hg/src/java/com/cenqua/fisheye/svn/SvnRepositoryScanner.java?r=70669da392559c65059162bf73a7e19850f03286#to187

In this method: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/~br=FE-3905-reindex-replay-smart-commits/FE-hg/src/java/com/cenqua/fisheye/rep/RepositoryScanner.java?r=3857293452930fde2bf7480ef751cbf6a24324ef#to384

by calling a sub-class filter content paths method.

This means for matching paths we will lookup the (String) paths 3 times instead of 2, but for non-matching paths, we'll only look them up once and we won't try to delete all their content docs, triggering unnecessarily small lucene commits.

We should modify the SortedIntSet inplace, so we don't use any more memory
fields.summary: Content Indexing: Filter the paths to index before processing the list twice.

fields.description: ... and then it does the per-repo metadata and content. Till then searches don't return diddly.

fields.description:
In OnDemand, customers cannot edit their symbolic rules, so often they are set up wrong - we end up content indexing their old_branches directory etc.

We want to be able to only index trunk, not trunk and root. This should be a FishEyeSysProps option that has to be enabled.
fields.summary: Content Indexing: Add an option to only index trunk, not root and trunk

fields.description:

AND her: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/~br=2.7-git-incremental-idx/FE-hg/src/java/com/atlassian/fisheye/dvcs/DvcsScanner.java?r=8d42c78d81a2bd1753bf269dbf6f68f5c000c9ce#to600
fields.summary: ReIndex: Only delete all the content docs if there are >0 docs in the index

fields.description:
FishEye/Crucible 2.7.10 bundles SVNKit 1.3.3 libraries, which are incompatible with Subversion 1.7.

Similar problems were reported by Hudson/Jenkins users after upgrading the SVN server to 1.7:
http://issues.hudson-ci.org/browse/HUDSON-9111
http://jenkins.361315.n4.nabble.com/Jenkins-cannot-connect-to-SVN-1-7-repositories-td4167322.html

SVNKit has released a 1.3.7 JAR to fix some of these outstanding issues.
http://svn.svnkit.com/repos/svnkit/tags/1.3.7/CHANGES.txt

As a workaround, please replace the bundled SVNKit JARS in {{$FISHEYE_INST/lib/svn}} with the JARs from SVNKit's download page, and rename them to match the names expected by Crucible.
fields.summary: SVNKit libraries incompatible with SVN 1.7

fields.description:
I have spent way too much time trying to figure out all the quirks of running FishEye / Crucible behind IIS 7 (see for instance here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/OAuth+after+Initial+Configuration+Does+Not+Work). It should be a supported configuration and work seamlessly. There should be a clear step by step guide on what to do on the web server side and how to configure JIRA and FishEye so that they can work together even when using some web front end like IIS or Apache.

I don't think that many people want to run FishEye on port 8060 and start it from command line...
fields.summary: Fully support web servers like Apache or IIS

fields.description:
When a large branch is copied within a SVN repository (let's say, a typical branch being around 8,000-24,000 directories and 90,000-350,000 files, not counting deleted content), generating a single changeset, and FishEye starts to index this single changeset, the instance may become unusable for several hours afterwards, although the instance may be [well tuned|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Tuning+FishEye]:

* [Decrease Block size|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Subversion]: A subversion copy is a single revision, so decreasing the number of fetched revisions from 400 to (say) 100 should not logically have any effect on this particular problem.
* [Increase heap size|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Tuning+FishEye#TuningFishEye-JavaHeapSize]: After increasing to {{-Xmx1536m}} the problem may get worse, because garbage collection may take longer, and may eventually cause timeouts even for accessing other repositories.
* [Decrease the number of initial / incremental indexing threads|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Configuring+Indexing]: Depending on the number of repositories an instance may have, decreasing below 2 would mean that other repositories would have to wait if one repository is doing a time consuming job, like the example given above.
* [Exclude files and directories|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Include+Exclude+Paths]: This is unfeasible in such a big repository, because Fisheye/Crucible only allows fixed paths for exclusion, and also we would have to spend days setting this up for a single branch, then repeat for hundreds of branches, and every new branch after this.
* [Split the repository into logical components|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Best+Practices+for+FishEye+Configuration]: This may also be unfeasible when customer's need to be able to follow history back to when files were first created, and the commit messages may also contain the associated Jira ticket number.

So the suggestions here are:
* FishEye/Crucible understanding links, which copies in subversion are, so it won't reindex.
* FishEye/Crucible copying the index data from the source to the destination instead of regenerating it.
* FishEye/Crucible not bottlenecking while indexing, especially when there are threads available. For example, an instance may have 3 threads available, but only one gets used per repository.
fields.summary: Improve the way FishEye handles huge SVN branching and moving

fields.description:
Is it possible to add some code metrics in fisheye like :
* average length of methods per developers. Is the developper writing long or short methods?
* average complexity of methods per developers. Is the developper writing complex methods with many loops and tests or simple methods?
* percentage of comment in code. Is the developper comment his code or not commenting it.
* average number of commits per issues. Average number of issues per commit. Is the developper solving the problem in one commit on main branch or is it solving many problems at the same time, ...?
* average commits on trunk vs branch. Is the developper commiting on branches or on the trunk?
fields.summary: add some code metrics

fields.summary: Describe SSL configuration for SMTP

fields.description:
Currently p4 config has a "disable multiple print" option, which if enabled means that FishEye will ask for file details one file at a time. 

This option was originally added because FishEye has a hard time detecting EOF between files from multiple-print p4 executions, leading to incorrect LOC and annotation problems in FishEye. The option can also be enabled when the number of requested files in a single multiple-print operation places too much load on the p4d server, leading to timeouts and excessive index times (see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-7863) 

Change the "disable multiple print" option to be a selectable dropdown of the batch size for files per p4 operation. A size of 1 is the equivalent of the old "disable multiple print" functionality, but the customer can also configure other batch sizes to balance the number of p4 client executions against the number of files requested per execution.
fields.summary: configurable batch size for p4 multiple print

fields.summary: Committer user name column out of sync with commit ID column when viewing source code

fields.description:
During indexing, the cross-repo index (used for quicknav) associates up to 100000 paths from the changeset with the changeset, but actually looks them ALL up.

Change this to a common limit of 10000 (common with the search indexing) and make it only look up the paths it needs.

Make the common limit configuable via a property.
fields.summary: Add a limit for the number of paths to index to a changeset

fields.description: Under certain conditions, the 2.6 upgrade tasks take a VERY long time to complete. The biggest component will be the determination of the ancestry for the first commits on a new tag or branch.
fields.summary: Add properties to stop branch and tag point ancestry detection for SVN

fields.description:
From Melanie Wright:
would be really really helpful to have a single doc to guide Bitbucket users on how to connect fisheye and/or crucible to bitbucket

which we could include here as well http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Integrating+FishEye+with+Other+Applications
fields.summary: Document in one place how to connect FE/CRU to bitbucket

fields.description:
The /changelog page in FishEye, when indexed by the GoogleBot is likely to cause FishEye to run out of memory eventually, for repositories of certain shapes. Most likely those with a high number (300K+) commits.
1 such repo is located at  http://svn.asterisk.org/svn/ .

FishEye could do a better job ensuring multiple consecutive or concurrent requests to the /changelog page doesn't cause the system to run out of memory.
fields.summary: Fix Performance issues of public FishEye instances without a /robots.txt barring the /changelog

fields.description:
If a changeset has a very large number of revisions, the Lucense document built for the changeset will have a very large array of NumericFields for the revids of those revisions. This is likely to cause heap exhaustion. 

Either such changesets will need to be indexed differently (perhaps split into multiple documents) or not at all.
fields.summary: Changesets with large number of revisions can exhaust heap

fields.description:
Currently, all of the EMail templates are stored in the app directory, not FISHEYE_INST.

Therefore, if you perform any customization of the templates, the modified templates must be moved manually to the new app directory following a Fisheye Upgrade.

This is needless to say unnecessary and partially defeats the purpose of having the FISHEYE_INST directory.

I imagine that there are other configuration files, etc., which are not in the FISHEYE_INST directory. A sweep should be made, so that all customizations are stored there vs. in the app directory.

Jordan Dea-Mattson
fields.summary: EMail templates should be stored in FISHEYE_INST not app directory

fields.description:
Until the upgrade tasks finish for all the repositories, hitting any page that references changesets from those repos (like the dashboard activity stream) will cause the calling thread to block, making FishEye non-responsive.

This is not a problem with small repos and they upgrade quickly, but larger repos can upgrade for up to 2 hours, so all the request threads will get used up till its unresponsive.
fields.summary: FishEye appears hung on upgrade, till upgrade finishes.

fields.description:
Fix is to upgrade 2.8.0 to at least 2.2.4

Hi there!

A client reported an issue with the UPM Plugin in FishEye 2.7.10 and I was able to reproduce it.

This is the issue: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-7881

{noformat}
com.atlassian.extras.decoder.api.LicenseDecoderNotFoundException: Could not find any valid decoders in [com.atlassian.extras.decoder.v2.Version2LicenseDecoder@f3dcf0, com.atlassian.extras.decoder.v1.Version1LicenseDecoder@2e2dc6] for license string
{noformat}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Enter in Fisheye's Administration page.
2. Click on Plugins.
3. Click on Upload Plugin.
4. Choose the file (atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin-2.0.jar).
5. Click on Upload.
6. Restart Fisheye.

The error start to be showed in the Plugins Page.

I attached a screenshot of it.

Thank you in advance.

Douglas Fabretti
Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Exception when upgrading to UPM 2.0 in Fisheye

fields.description:
When a file is moved and edited in a commit and the resulting similarity between the 'from' and 'to' paths is below 70%, FishEye will correctly process the 'to' as an added file.

Unfortunately, the 'from' path is *NOT* processed at all and therefore no delete is registered in the commit.
fields.summary: Git: Moved file with < 70% is treated as an add (correctly), but the corresponding delete is missing

fields.description:
JIRA allows administrators to change avatars of users on their behalf.

It would be great if FishEye would have the same feature
fields.summary: Allow admin to change users avatar

fields.description:
*Many* users run FishEye on repositories containing languages other than Java and would like to be able to define a custom colour/color highlighting scheme to make code more readable.

Your own products are launched and managed via shell scripts.  Surely someone reviewed those?!

the previous ticket 921 was closed saying "The format is not currently documented but it should not be too difficult to derive from the existing def files."

Sorry @Conor McNeil [Atlassian] - but that is bogus.  

Its clear that the files use some sort of sed like regexp to find matching keywords, but whats all the business about contexts, and different types of keywords, comments, identification, string, etc.  

There is a serious need to get this together. Support  for 8 filetypes is weak.
 Even free notepad tools like np++, vim, gedit, jedit, etc, etc support hundreds.

Please spend 2 hours and update the current documentation to contain more then a code snippet.
fields.summary: Add custom syntax highlighting for shell scripts

fields.description:
See the 'steps to reproduce' instructions on FE-2143 to see how to reproduce this issue.

The problem here is that FishEye will treat the file as a binary if it has been binary or a directory anywhere in its ancestry.
fields.summary: Fisheye treats files as binary if they used to have a svn:mime-type property, even after the property has been removed

fields.description:
With the completion of FE-212, FishEye now supports SSL but when enabled user's can still access the application over non-SSL.  This is problematic for two reasons:

h4. Reduced Security
Users can subvert SSL and still login insecurely.  Our internal security policies state that our applications must use SSL if they collect credentials.

h4. Bugs
We encountered a scenario in v2.7.6 where if someone accessed the app over http, everything worked fine until they tried to create a Crucible review and clicked the Explore Repositories button, it hung.  Debugging showed it was an http/https conflict (XSS) because our "Site URL" configuration setting had "https". {code}Unsafe JavaScript attempt to access frame with URL http://code.company.com/cru/CR-37 from frame with URL https://code.company.com/cru/CR-37/edit-browse/~author%3Djsmith/myrepo/. Domains, protocols and ports must match.{code}
fields.summary: Support forcing SSL to improve security and eliminate bugs

fields.description:
Some REST calls like {{http://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/latest/wadl/fisheye.html#d2e4}} have a hardcoded limit of max. 3000 results.
As some queries can result in > 3000 results, and can't be further simplified (e.g. a revision can have more than 3000 entries) it would be useful to be able to specify a _maxReturn_ exceeding 3000.
fields.summary: Allow REST calls to return more than 3000 results

fields.description:
Fisheye shows the differences of versions without sensitive case differences, because when the languaje to develop is Visual Basic, it ommited the uppercase and lowercase.

Need to configure if I want ommited this or no
fields.summary: Case insensitive diff in Fisheye

fields.description:
Nowadays, all activity from a JIRA project, regardless of component, will be displayed in the FishEye/Crucible Activity Stream. The link is at project level.

Some customers may only want the activities of a specific component of their JIRA project to be streamed to their FishEye repository / Crucible project with no other activities from other components.
fields.summary: Add possibility of filtering the Activity Stream per JIRA component

fields.description:
In the process of installation of JIRA+Fisheye to connect with subversion when I noticed that Fisheye 2.7.10 state's that is does not support subversion 1.7.  The Major-blocking problem here is I am using Collabnet's Subversion Edge 2.2 which is using Subversion 1.7.1.

What exactly is not supported from Fisheye? The repositories between subversion 1.6 & 1.7 are essentially the same.  Will most of the basic functionality work?  Does fisheye not use the SSH/Webdav interface to obtain the information?
fields.summary: Support for Subversion 1.7

fields.description:
Currently you can configure Fisheye to use TLS as we set mail.smtp.starttls.enable to TLS

But if you're using SMTPS we need to set mail.smtp.ssl.enable value.

This means Fisheye won't work with Amazon's SES SMTP gateway 

h3. Workaround
h4. Option #1

Use an [SMTP proxy|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SMTP_proxy]. Examples:
* https://github.com/kz26/mailproxy
* https://docs.nginx.com/nginx/admin-guide/mail-proxy/mail-proxy/

h4. Option #2

Configure mail library using system properties. Steps:

1. Create a {{javamail.address.map}} file in the {{JAVA_HOME/lib}} directory. Content of the file should be as follows. This file will switch default email protocol from smtp to smtps:

{noformat}
rfc822=smtps
{noformat}

(!) Keep in mind that this will affect all Java applications running on this machine. In case Fisheye/Crucible is not the only one, consider installing another, dedicated JRE for Fisheye/Crucible with this file present.

2. Set the following JVM properties in FISHEYE_OPTS 

{noformat}
-Dmail.smtp.ssl.enable=true -Dmail.smtps.auth=true -Dmail.smtps.host=smtp.gmail.com -Dmail.smtps.port=465
{noformat}

* mail.smtp.ssl.enable - this will enable SMTPS instead of StartTLS
* mail.smtps.auth - to require authentication for SMTPS
* mail.smtps.host / mail.smtps.port - values from the 'Administration > Server > Mail server' page will be ignored when SMTPS is enabled, therefore you have to provide them using these flags; use your server address and port, the example above works with GMail

You may also want to add the following ones:

{noformat}
-Dmail.debug=true -Dmail.smtp.ssl.protocols=TLSv1.2
{noformat}

* mail.debug - extra debug logging for troubleshooting
* mail.smtp.ssl.protocols=TLSv1.2  - restrict protocol to TLS v 1.2

3. Configure other mail settings on the 'Administration > Server > Mail server > Edit config' page

* Use TLS/SSL = set to false, as you will be connecting via SMTPS, not StartTLS
* Username / Password = put credentials
fields.summary: Fisheye mail doesn't work with SMTPS

fields.description:
Choosing a mercurial branch name in the activity stream branch selector shows that there are zero commits under that branch when actually are.  I believe this may have to do with the url encoding of the + symbol.

This is also a problem in Crucible.  On the add content screen (repository changes), filter on a branch that has a "+" character, move to the edit details screen, and then back to the add content screen and the filter will no longer have the + character which breaks the filter.
fields.summary: Mercurial Branches with "+" characters cause issues in activity stream

fields.description:
In http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Using+Smart+Commits

We say that we can use multiple Smart Commits in a commit message by putting 1 action per line. However the examples given in this page do not reflect that.

We should also tell the users that each Smart Commit should exist on one single line.

eg:

"JRA-123 #comment this is a comment" 

will work but

"JRA-123 #comment this is
a comment"

will only add 'this is' as a comment to the issue JRA-123
fields.summary: Update CAC documentation about multiline Smart Commits

fields.description:
Nowadays, blank lines and comment lines are counted as valid lines of *code*, when they're not.

This would allow measuring the workload of stories and tasks, and can also be used as a reference for evaluating developers.
fields.summary: Add an option to exclude blank lines and comment lines from LoC count

fields.description: We have a bot user named "Builder", who makes some changes in the repo every time we trigger a build. We would like to exclude these changes in the repo Activity View and also from the generated e-mails (we "Watch" our repo and get notification of all the changes to our e-mails). Currently the Builder bot generates too much useless noise in these channels.
fields.summary: Have the ability to create personal filters on the repository feed

fields.description:
Scenario:
A repository has been indexed in FishEye 2.5.x or earlier
Upgrade to 2.7+

Result:
A commit event will be fired on the first commit for ALL commits, even those already scanned.

If a repository contains "smart commit" commit comments that have already been indexed, all the old commits with "smart commit" syntax will be replayed.
fields.summary: Upgrade from 2.5->2.7 fires events for all commits and replays all smart commits

fields.description:
Hello there.

I just answered an Issue that the client suggested an improvement for us.

Here is what he wrote:

{quote}This is possibly because in your dragon's quest is not written to specify linked issue while creating the review:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ATLAS/Dragons+Stage+6+-+Get+JIRA+and+Crucible+Talking

Can we update the documentation to the newest version of Fisheye/Crucible?

Thank you in advance,
Douglas Fabretti
Atlassian Support.

fields.summary: Issue Transition controls don't appear when closing a review

fields.description:
When creating reviews through rest in three stages (create review, add changeset, transition from draft to in review) sometimes the last operation (draft -> review transition) is rolled back a few minutes after its been committed.  The review history shows the draft -> review transition but the review is in the draft state.

I've been able to reproduce this by creating review through rest in parallel threads until the problem occurs.
fields.summary: Rest transactions are rolled back after they've been committed

fields.description:
a relatively common use case for p4 branch specs is to move them around (edit, delete, etc). the branch specs are more of a temporary 'view' than a branch in other scms.

under this use case, fisheye can be very wrong in terms of ancestry of files and changesets.

we should at least have a system property to turn off branch spec support entirely. this would put every changeset on the 'head' branch, though you would still be able to see the repository structure at the directory level, and integrations would be tracked at the file level - so diffs of integrated files would show you what you expect to see.

the side effect of this is that the commit graph would show all commits in linear history. you wont be able to see integrations at the changeset level.
fields.summary: fisheye doesnt handle p4 branch specs in ways that p4 supports

fields.description:
When I create a review through smart commit, I got the task also to summarize the review.
The reviewers can only complete the review.

What we want to achieve is that the review has following parameters

author = developer
moderator = lead
reviewer = developer2

such that it is not the developer, but someone else who can summarize the review.

SAC indicated that this was not yet supported.
fields.summary: As a developer, I can specify the moderator of a review in my smart commit, such that I don't need to summarize it.

fields.description:
When {{DefaultUserManager}} is being instantiated by Spring, the constructor calls {{upgradeData()}}, which calls {{removeDeletedAdminGroups()}}.

{{removeDeletedAdminGroups()}} calls {{getExternalGroupNames()}}, which calls {{listGroupNames()}} to retrieve all the groups defined in Crowd if it's configured to use Crowd.

This method calls the {{listGroupNames}} method on {{CrowdAuth}}. If Crowd is not up at that time, the {{CrowdClient}} throws an {{InvalidCrowdServiceException}}, which is rethrown as an {{AuthenticationException}}.

{{listGroupNames}} method on {{DefaultUserManager}} swallows any exception thrown by {{CrowdAuth}} (though it logs it as an error) and return an empty list.

Unfortunately, {{removeDeletedAdminGroups()}} method then assumes that there is no groups defined in Crowd and removes admin privileges for all groups that are not defined internally by FishEye.

fields.description:
If you perform a commit, if the commit log contains a carriage return, any command located after the carriage return will not be processed.

For example, using the following commit log:
"ISSUE-1 #comment this comment
continues here #time 1d"

Only "this comment" will be added to the jira ISSUE-1 entry; #time will be completely ignored.

Carriage returns should be treated like any other characters or ignored.
In the above example:
"this comment
continues here"

should be added to ISSUE-1.
fields.summary: Support carriage return for FishEye Plugin smart commit

fields.description:
This is needed to correlate changesets to a project for perforce projects.

* SpiRecentChangesSearcher2.transformResult needs to detect P4Changesets and get their 'fixes' by calling getFixes.
* ChangesetDataFE needs to be extended to include a List<String> of fixes.
* the field on ChangesetDataFE must be populated during transformResult

This change is needed to support p4 jobIds in version 3.4.7, 3.4.8 of the JIRA FishEye Plugin.


The FishEye Plugin also needs to consume this job data on the JIRA end.
See also: https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/FISH-554
fields.summary: P4 JobIds are not being returned with the REST call to rest-service-fe/changeset-v1/listChangesets

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a code injection vulnerability in FishEye and Crucible caused by an underlying vulnerability in the third-party Webwork 2 framework.

All versions of FishEye/Crucible from 2.0 up are affected.

This issue is reported in our security advisories on these pages:
[FishEye|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+and+Crucible+Security+Advisory+2012-01-31]
[Crucible|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/FishEye+and+Crucible+Security+Advisory+2012-01-31]

This vulnerability is a variant of a [recently disclosed|https://www.sec-consult.com/fxdata/seccons/prod/temedia/advisories_txt/20120104-0_Apache_Struts2_Multiple_Critical_Vulnerabilities.txt] Struts2 vulnerability
fields.summary: Webwork 2 vulnerability

fields.description:
Currently, when a user or groups is added to FishEye via the admin UI (built-in auth), the following pattern must match:
[a-zA-Z0-9\-_\.@\\]+
ie. alphanumeric, underscore, at ('@'), dot, dash or backslash .

When a user is added to FishEye via a synch with an external directory (LDAP, Crowd or JIRA, say) the above regexp is not checked.


Consider dropping or expanding the above restriction on FishEye built-auth.

*NB* we can not allow /s in usernames because usernames appear in FishEye/Crucible URLS.
fields.summary: Consider dropping the restriction on allowed characters in usernames

fields.description:
p4 2011.1 introduced a new feature called "streams" which is similar, but not the exactly the same as a branch. while fisheye will index commits on a "streams" depot, the streams will not be recognised as separate branches.

we should be checking for streams as well as branch specs when indexing commits.

a current workaround is to create branch specs to match the streams. 


----------------

here you can see the commits that were actually made:
!FE3886_1.png|height=200px!

And the fact that all commits appear on the "head" branch:
!FE3886_2.png|height=200px!

Using the workaround, i created 2 branch specs:
MAIN (//depot/... //depot/MAIN/...)
DEV (//depot/MAIN/... //depot/DEV/...)

The commits are now represented in the following way (note the DEV branch spec):
!FE3886_3.png|height=200px!

And they appear like the following when browsing in FishEye:
|!FE3886_4.png|height=200px!|!FE3886_5.png|height=200px!
fields.summary: Support for Streams in p4
Smart Commits: Using the #time command with a complex time format (i.e. 2d 4h) only saves the 2d part

fields.description:
While performing a re-indexing of my repository in FISHEYE, I repeatedly pressed the *Refresh* icon to see what was happening.
Sometimes the *Recent Activity* frame showed 10 actions and there was no scroll bar
Other times the *Recent Activity* frame showed 11 actions and there would be a scroll bar that pushed the refresh button to the left.

Effectively, I had to always move my mouse left and right in order to keep pressing the *Refresh* icon. It would not stay in the same place.

To Replicate:
1. Perform a repository action (such as _Re-Index_)
2. Under the _Summary_ page, try to repeatedly press the *Refresh* icon on the top right
3. Sometimes the icon will move to the left because of a scroll bar

Chrome version 16.0.912.63 m
Windows XP
fields.summary: Refresh button on Repository->Summary window moves around

fields.description:
[Associating a Group with a Repository|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Associating+a+Group+with+a+Repository] seems to be out of date - group access to repositories is now set within the individual repository properties:

[Configuring Permissions for a Specific Repository|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Permissions]

The sections on [Configuring Anonymous Access|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Permissions#Permissions-ConfiguringAnonymousAccess] and [Configuring User Group Access|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Permissions#Permissions-ConfiguringUserGroupAccess] start with:


{quote}
To configure the permissions for all repositories,
{quote}

But then go on to talk about navigating to permissions for *a specific repository* or repository defaults. Isn't this contradictory?
fields.summary: Clean up documentation about permissions

fields.description:
JIRA Fisheye Plugin: v3.4.7
JIRA: v4.4.3
Fisheye: 2.7.8

When using smart commits with JIRA http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Using+Smart+Commits, when using the #resolve command, a user should be able to pass in the resolution.

- Commit a change with message: "ISSUE_KEY #resolve Duplicate #comment Resolving as duplicate"
- Navigate to the issue in JIRA

*Expected*: Issue to be resolved as duplicate and "Resolving as duplicate" added as comment

*Actual*: "Resolving as duplicate" is added as comment, issue is resolved as Fixed.
fields.summary: Smart Commits: Cannot set the resolution when using the "#resolve" command

fields.description:
Start with a FeCru installation with both license filled in.
Then remove e.g. the Crucible license and Update.
Go to the license screen again, the Crucible license is now replaced by the text "Disabled".
Now when you try to Update you get the error "The Crucible license key you have entered is invalid.".
fields.summary: Removed license gets replaced by "Disabled", preventing Update

fields.description:
How to reproduce:
1. Integrate a Fisheye and a Crowd instance. Add a few users to Crowd and make them available to the FE App.
2. Run the Sync in FE. Nothing will happen (no users will be synced).
3. Login to FE using a Crowd user. The authentication works and the user is added to the User list in the Admin console
4. Run the Sync. The Crowd user will be *removed* from the User list in the Admin console. In the database it will have its name appended with "_old".

Instead of adding new users to FE or just updating them, the Sync removes all Crowd users.

The FE and Crowd logs don't show any error. When logging the REST messages between FE and Crowd, all calls end with "200" and the users are provided by Crowd correctly when a sync is run:
{code}
"<users expand="user"><user name="user1"><link rel="self" href="http://nastro-azzuro:8095/crowd/rest/usermanagement/1/user?username=user1"/></user><user name="user2"><link rel="self" href="http://nastro-azzuro:8095/crowd/rest/usermanagement/1/user?username=user2"/></user></users>"
{code}
fields.summary: Crowd Sync removes users instead of adding/updating them

fields.description:
We're trying to handle some Plugin Framework events (e.g., {{PluginFrameworkStartedEvent}}) in UPM 2.0.  This works fine for other Atlassian applications, but FishEye/Crucible doesn't seem to register any.  I've tried using both the Event 2.0 annotation-based ({{@EventListener}}) system and the older system ({{handleEvent(Event)}}) as documented in the tutorial on developer.atlassian.com. As it is, I'm not seeing any generic events being published (even with a breakpoint set).

Some sort of {{ApplicationStartedEvent}} would also be useful.
fields.summary: Publish plugin framework events
